data.title: Please please please fix your machines!
data.text:
Got excited about this as a friend researched it.
Rushed in the door to stand in awe of the many old school machines that line the walls. Put $20 in the change machine to find that many of the machines were broke for one reason or another?
Was very disappointed and we actually didn't stop for the 1-2 hours as planned because of the lack of playable machines (T2, street fighter 2 etc).
Now owning a machine myself I know that it's not easy calling out someone to fix these things. But trust me I would have stayed for hours pumping money into your bar and machines should you have had more to play with.

data.title: a blast from the past
data.text:
a small fee but a chance to play many old retro arcade games including pacman, track and field, centipede, etc.
also music and dancing going on whilst others are set down playing nes games like mario kart and knockout? definitely an experience to be had for an hour or so, think I recall a few games werent working but a great idea.

data.title: Nice idea, but not worth the money.
data.text: Checked out this bar right after they opened for the night. Wanted to play a couple of the arcade games, but two took my money and another had a bunch of dead pixels/graphics. Kinda disappointing, so we didn't stay very long.

data.title: Overly hyped
data.text: As a videogamer I was excited to check out this place.  I found found it dark, uninviting, and a lot of games didn't work.

data.title: So fun!!
data.text: I didn't have any drinks here, but playing on the old arcade games was so much fun!! I am glad my friend recommended this place to me!

data.title: Gaming and alcohol, winning combination.
data.text:
I've been to Insert Coin(s) every time I've visited Las Vegas. It combines a number of things I enjoy: retro gaming, music and alcohol.

This place is definitely worth checking out with a group of friends if they're into gaming - and even if they're not, the majority of people will still enjoy sipping rum and playing Mario Kart 64!

Insert Coin(s) is top of my list for places to go in Downtown, and there's no doubt I'll be returning on my next trip to Vegas!

user_location.name: Welwyn Garden City, England, United Kingdom

data.title: Has potential, but needs to do better
data.text: It's a great concept in a great location, but they really need to do more with this place.  The games are cheap to play but the variety isn't that great.  Is worth visiting if you are in the area but after an hour you will want to move on.

data.title: Old School - For Better or Worse
data.text: Went here on the recommendation of some acquaintances for some old time Arcade gaming. The classics are here - Space Invaders, Double Dragon, etc. The feeling of old school was awesome, but the buttons were broke just like the old days as well. A great time nonetheless....

data.title: Awful service. Bad attitudes from bar tenders and manager that was on duty.
data.text: We brought in about 20 of our friends to come have a good time and play some games celebrating my cousins 21st Bday. We got to the bar everyone ordered a drink and when we asked if they would please change out a game for us, the bar tender flat out said NO I'm not doing that. We were shocked so we asked the other bar tender on duty who also said NO to us. No explanation just No and turned their back on us. When I asked for the manager she gave me an attitude as if I was in the wrong, and said well your game is on now so.... The bar tenders didn't look at us for the rest of the night, for an establishment called insert coins changing a game out shouldn't be such a huge issue and if your super busy which you weren't, it was a Thurs. then at least kindly explain to your customers why you can't change a disc out even though they're paying $10 and up for a drink.

data.title: Great idea for fun with groups!
data.text: We went here in a Sunday evening with a group of about 10 friends. We had the bottle service and a large booth. The guys' birthday we were celebrating is a gamer so this was an amazing surprise for him! He loved it -- and even the non-gamers did to. The DJ was bumping, our cocktail hostess was awesome, and the games were a blast. I thoroughly enjoyed having our own private area to kick back in and thought it was well worth price.

data.title: Ummm....Just Buy The Games Instead
data.text:
For the price of a few drinks, you can pretty much buy any game here and the booths certainly don't seem worth it.  I did like the old classic coin operated arcade games, so I did enjoy drinking and playing arcade games.  But paying to play Playstation or Xbox games just doesn't seem worth it.  

If you want a break from the flashy Fremont Street Experience, then this is a good pit stop.  Also, if you like the idea of having a venue solely to socialize with other gamers, this could also be good.  Beyond that, I found this a fun as more of a novelty than a serious place I'd enjoy hanging out.

data.title: So Fun!!!
data.text:
Had my BDay party here. So fun, the DJs played some old school hip hop. There was even an impromptu break dancing contest. The music was so good, we actually got on the dance floor. Which normally doesn't happen at some of the clubs on the strip since they are so small and crowded.

You can reserve a table for a reasonable rate. You get a booth with 1 playstation and 1 xbox stations for your friends to enjoy.

data.title: Teenage flashback
data.text: Lots of old school arcade games, three of my favorites, Tapper, Centipede and Track and Field. Plus they serve drinks what's not to like. They do have a cover charge. I can't remember if it starts at 9pm or 10pm, it was a long night.

data.title: Insert fun
data.text: A bar only with games! What is not to like. Everything from old school arcade games to xbox games. plus they serve alcohol. Beers and Teken is highly recommanded

data.title: Great Night
data.text:
We had this planned for a visit from the start of our holiday.

We were out on freemont street before hand and went here later on. 
Had a great night playing on some of the games that we hadnt played since we were kids!

The DJ was great and got on the dancefloor watching some of the pros in a dance off which was a great time!

Recommend for a visit!

data.title: SNOBBED!!!
data.text: I went to Insert Coin(s) tonight, we made a detour, almost 50$ in cab fare to get there to be snobbed. I found this place online and it was advertising their great games and such. We found out that if you don't want to pay the 125$ bottle service well you are stuck with common arcade games and terrible service. I was snobbed by the hostess and by 2 barmaids. I had high hopes for this place and ended up very disapointed.... u want something fun to do in Vegas, go to a shooting range and don't go to Insert Coins.

data.title: Good Night for a group of lads
data.text: There's a great selection of games here and its a unique experience to sit at a bar drinking while playing GoldenEye on a N64. I wasn't looking forward to going here but i was persuaded by my friends and i really had a good night. Its worth a visit for the unique experience alone.

data.title: Doesn't Live Up to Its Hype
data.text:
Based on Insert Coin(s) website, this was one of the things my husband was looking forward to the most in Las Vegas.  We rode the Deuce from the Strip, which was a whole other ordeal, and we arrived at Freemont Street.  There is a cover, which was $10 for out of state men, and free for women.

The web site seemed to imply that the club was a huge hot spot with a large selection of games.  We found that only about half of the listed games were there and operational.  There was a DJ, and I actually enjoyed the music, but the few games that I was interested in were out of order.  I ended up chillaxing on the couch while my husband played for about 30 minutes.  After he played the X-Men arcade game, he was ready to go.  No one came to check on or wait on me while I was sitting there the whole time.  About only twenty people total were in the bar at midnight on a Friday night.

The concept has a lot of potential, and I don't know if we visited the bar on a downswing or if it could be revamped into something really unique.  We ended up having more fun just walking up and down Freemont Street and people watching.

data.title: Nice retro games
data.text: I liked the collection of retro games, I felt at home. They had some OK beers too, but the selection was somewhat limited.

data.title: Not cool...
data.text: I was really excited when I heard about this place for my bachelor party. I talked all my friends into going and thought it was going to be great to challenge each other to all the old games. Unfortunately at least half of the games did not work at all. Of the half that did work, most of them had broken buttons / joysticks and would eat your quarters. The staff was happy to replace your quarters but it was frustrating to keep going and telling them that the games had taken them. Overall I would say this place did not meet my expectations at all.
